questions.question: The Civil Disobedience Movement was launched in which year?
Who launched the Civil Disobedience Movement?
questions.answer: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.question: Which event marked the beginning of the Civil Disobedience Movement?
questions.answer: Dandi March

questions.question: The Civil Disobedience Movement was started to oppose which law?
questions.answer: Salt Law

questions.question: From where did Gandhiji start the Dandi March?
questions.answer: Sabarmati Ashram

questions.question: What was the main objective of the movement?
questions.answer: Complete independence

questions.question: Which section of people actively participated in the movement?
questions.answer: People from all sections

questions.question: Which agreement led to the suspension of the movement?
questions.answer: Gandhi-Irwin Pact

questions.question: Which conference followed the Gandhi-Irwin Pact?
questions.answer: Second Round Table Conference

questions.question: The Civil Disobedience Movement was mainly a ____ movement.
questions.answer: Peaceful mass

questions.question: What was the Civil Disobedience Movement?
questions.answer: It was a mass movement launched by Mahatma Gandhi to disobey unjust British laws peacefully.

questions.question: Why did Gandhiji start the Dandi March?
questions.answer: To protest against the British Salt Law which affected all Indians.

questions.question: What was the importance of the Dandi March?
questions.answer: It symbolized mass defiance of British authority and united people.

questions.question: What was the Gandhi-Irwin Pact?
questions.answer: An agreement between Gandhiji and Viceroy Irwin to suspend the movement temporarily.

questions.question: Why was the Civil Disobedience Movement important?
questions.answer: It strengthened the national movement and spread the demand for independence.
